description: A boxy, compact laser sight that mounts on a Picatinny rail, providing the shooter with reliable aim at shorter distances.  This one emits red laser: the most common kind of lasers.  Ineffective at longer ranges and in bright environments.

notes: negative trim is to cover the rail mount

name.str: Steiner TOR Mini green laser sight

description: An ultra-compact laser sight that mounts on a Picatinny rail, providing the shooter with reliable aim at shorter distances.  This one emits green laser, attested to remaining more visible than the more-common red laser in adverse conditions.  Still, it remains ineffective at longer ranges and in bright environments.
//weight: weight is stated to be with batteries
typical Duracell CR1/3N battery weighs around 3.3g
unless togglable/draining lasers are implemented, we assume the battery is always in and always active

notes: negative trim is to cover the rail mount

//notes: AN/PEQ-15 is US military nomeclature for this laser sight
The C in ATPIAL-C denotes that this is a commercial, civilian-legal variant
this model also features an IR illuminator
description: A boxy, elaborate-looking laser sight that mounts on a Picatinny rail, providing the shooter with reliable aim at shorter distances.  This model is the commercial counterpart of a famous military laser sight employed in the US Armed Forces.  This one emits red laser: the most common kind of lasers.  Ineffective at longer ranges and in bright environments.
//weight: weight is stated to be with batteries
unless togglable/draining lasers are implemented, we assume the battery is always in and always active

notes: lifetime is given when running both visible and IR laser on high settings
CR123 is equivalent to the DL123 listed in specs in sources
